required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Adult Polysomnography Primary Insomnia Cross Over Study (0928-049)(TERMINATED)
clinical_study.official_title: A Double-Blind, Placebo Controlled, Randomized, Cross-Over Polysomnographic Study of MK0928 15 mg in Adult Patients With Primary Insomnia

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is determine whether this drug will improve your insomnia in terms of decreasing your time to fall asleep and allowing you to stay asleep longer. The drug will be compared against placebo in order to determine if there's a difference.

primary_outcome.measure: Wake after sleep onset and Latency to persistent sleep

secondary_outcome.measure: Subjective total sleep time and subjective time to sleep onset

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of Primary Insomnia
- Patient is willing to stay overnight at a sleep laboratory for a total of 7 nights
- Patient is willing to avoid alcohol on PSG visits
- Patient will avoid napping during the course of the study
- Patient's bedtime is between 9pm and 1am
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of substance abuse, bipolar disorder or psychotic disorder
- Difficulty sleeping due to other medical condition
- History of narcolepsy, circadian rhythm sleep disorder, parasomnia, sleep apnea, periodic limb movements or restless legs syndrome
- History of neoplastic malignancy within the last 5 years
- Positive alcohol breath test during the screening visits
